medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal bloating and pain localized to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 2am with abdominal bloating, epigastric pressure, and cramping pain that persisted despite passing a solid stool. Pain was constant overnight, gradually spreading and localizing to the right abdomen, especially the right lower quadrant. The symptoms worsened when sitting and relieved by standing.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD treated with Ranitidine; mild hyperglycemia managed with exercise and diet.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of myocardial infarction at age unspecified, has Type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Mother has no significant history. Mother's siblings have throat and breast cancer. Sister has Type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Brother has coronary artery disease and died of myocardial infarction at age unspecified.
